definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: When he broke his leg he had to walk on crutches.
sentences.chinese: 他摔断腿后，只好柱着两根拐杖走路。

sentences.english: I say, John, I see your flamingo with the broken leg!
sentences.chinese: 我说，约翰，我看见你那只断腿的红鹤。

sentences.english: His leg was set at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 他的断腿已在医院里接上了。

sentences.english: Spraining the ankle and breaking the leg are the common things during the match.
sentences.chinese: 扭伤脚踝，摔断腿是比赛当中很常见的事情。

sentences.english: His broken leg condemned him to a wheelchair.
sentences.chinese: 他的断腿迫使他只能坐轮椅。

sentences.english: My broken leg was extremely painful.
sentences.chinese: 我的断腿疼得非常厉害。

sentences.english: Then start it at once while I'm splinting his broken leg.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，我给他的断腿上绑带，你立刻开始急救。

sentences.english: Who has repaired the broken leg of the table?
sentences.chinese: 谁把桌子的断腿修好了？

sentences.english: One broken baluster is placed on the pediment like a fractured leg.
sentences.chinese: 一条断了的石栏杆竖在平台的前端，如同一条断腿。

sentences.english: Your dancing is horrible, I hope you break your legs.
sentences.chinese: 你的舞烂透了，真希望你摔断腿。

sentences.english: When I broke my leg, I spend a whole month in bed.
sentences.chinese: 我摔断腿以后，在床上整整躺了一个月。

sentences.english: If you hadn't slipped and fallen, you wouldn't have broken your leg.
sentences.chinese: 要是你没滑倒，你就不会断腿了。

definition: to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
to fall and break/to break (bones) by falling
